title: Collaborative E-Learning Design in Christian Education: Simulation/VR-Based Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational Christian theology and experience with digital learning tools
context.additional_context: Christian education applying collaborative learning and scaffolding in simulation/VR environments, grounded in graduate-level social contextual understanding.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze Christian ethics cases in VR simulations and, through collaborative learning, propose at least three practical implementation plans.
Learners can develop at least two types of learning activities for Christian education themes (comparison/contrast) using LAMS-based learning design templates.
Learners achieve over 85% feedback appropriateness in peer assessments by applying scaffolding strategies

resources: LAMS Learning Design System Access Permissions

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
